column4: folks.. this isnt an urgent question, however my transmission torrent client has been downloading really slow.. no firewall is enabled in my router or ubuntu desktop, and i forwarded my transmission port which is currently open. any ideas/suggestions?
how many peers do you have for the file?
i have 3 downloads and each one is 12 - 20
if you have 2 peers on dialup connections, the file transfer is going to suck
im on a 1.5 mbps connection
try setting the minimum speed higher
higher than 250?
might be called, connect to peers if speed is below
i dont use it, i use ktorrent but you might be able to get more speed that way
i dont have an option like that in transmission
thats the maximum download?
yes
no minimum download speed
i just found a min limit speed i believe
hmmm, try limiting your upload a little more, see if it creeps up
just less
try it, see what happens
are you torrenting on other systems?
correct
nope
http://forum.transmissionbt.com/viewtopic.php?t=4202
my downloads were listed on as well over a few hunder seeders and leechers
